title: Castillo San Felipe del Morro
subTitle: GUIDED TOUR
description:
Learn about the story behind one of the greatest wonders of military engineering in Spain: from colonization to World War II.

Few structures represent the legacy of Puerto Rico in the Caribbean and the Americas more than the Castle San Felipe del Morro. This fortification at the corner of the islet of the Old San Juan now welcomes cruises sailing in and out of the bay. During most of its 500-year history, it was an important military post for Spain and later for the United States. 

When you walk through the narrow entrance and see the flags waving in the strong Atlantic breeze, It's easy to transport yourself to another era in history and imagine soldiers in old-fashioned uniforms marching along the edge of the wall where the cannons fit comfortably into the pockets.
